title: Code Resources for MEC-24-1288
text:
Context
This resource contains the code used to generate and analyze data for publication MEC-24-1288.

Global availability of plant DNA barcodes as genomic resources to support basic and policy-relevant biodiversity research
Authors: Tyler R. Kartzinel ^1,2,*^, Hannah K. Hoff 1,2 , Timothy Divoll 3 , Bethan L. Littleford- Colquhoun 1,2 , Heidi Anderson 4 , Mary K. Burak 1,2 , Maria Kuzmina 5 , Paul M. Musili 6 , Haldre Rogers 7 , Alejandra J. Troncoso 8,9 , Rebecca Y. Kartzinel 1,10 .


1 Department of Ecology, Evolution, & Organismal Biology, Brown University, Providence, RI 02912, USA


2 Institute at Brown for Environment and Society, Brown University, Providence, RI 02912, USA


3 Center for Computation and Visualization, Brown University, Providence, RI 02912, USA


4 Yellowstone Center for Resources, Yellowstone National Park, Mammoth Hot Springs, Wyoming, USA


5 Centre for Biodiversity Genomics, University of Guelph, Guelph, Ontario, Canada, N1G 2W1


6 Botany Department, National Museums of Kenya, Nairobi, Kenya 00100


7 Department of Fish and Wildlife Conservation, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA 24061, USA


8 Instituto de Ecología y Biodiversidad (IEB), Santiago, Chile


9 Departamento de Biología, Universidad de La Serena, La Serena, Chile


10 Brown University Herbarium, Brown University, Providence, RI 02912, USA


* Tyler R. Kartzinel


Email: tyler_kartzinel@brown.edu.


Data Availability: All data required to complete the analyses are included in Datasets S1-S3. Raw downloads from public data repositories will be archived as versions of record used in these analyses at Dryad.

title: Introduction
text:
